2. Fixed Scheduler bug occured when objects that have same address are inserted and removed in same tick. (refer the #17149)

thanks.

[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
[Linux] AudioEngine does not erase audio instance (id) after playback
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: Debian (Jessie)
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Play > 32 sound effects and let them finish playing on their own
2. Any sound effect after will "Fail to play %s cause by limited max instance of AudioEngine"

Potential fix:
I'm not too familiar with the code base I only skimmed through it.

In AudioEngine-linux.cpp AudioEngineImpl::onSoundFinished(...) the corresponding id is not removed from the AudioEngine. Simply calling AudioEngine::remove(id) seemed like fixed this issue.

data.title: 3.14 linux linker failed on glfw
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create blank cpp project
2. run `cocos run -p linux`
3. you will get errors like

```
[100%] Linking CXX executable bin/MyGame
lib/libcocos2dInternal.a(CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp.o): In function `cocos2d::GLViewImpl::setFullscreen(GLFWvidmode const&, GLFWmonitor*)':
~/test/cocos2d/cocos/platform/desktop/CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp:600: undefined reference to `glfwSetWindowMonitor'
lib/libcocos2dInternal.a(CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp.o): In function `cocos2d::GLViewImpl::setWindowed(int, int)':
~/test/cocos2d/cocos/platform/desktop/CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp:613: undefined reference to `glfwSetWindowMonitor'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

data.title: Possible Memory Bad Access Error on cocos2d::Scheduler
Android build freezing when audio file is played Cocos2d-x 3.13.1 and 3.14
data.body:
[log.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/695970/log.txt)

[audiotest.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/695975/audiotest.zip)

- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1 and 3.14
- devices test on: Nexus 6P with Android v7.1.1
- developing environments
   - NDK version: crystax-ndk-10.3.1
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: -
   - browser type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Play an ogg audio file several times. In the attached project the same file is played 400ms apart 5 times.
Game freezes when experimental::AudioEngine::play2d is called.

OGG audio file is in the attached audiotest.zip project, and the logcat output log.txt is also attached to this post.

Android build command used: cocos compile -p android -m debug --ap android-15

label without outline&shadow is blending with scene or previous activity not the background of cocos ui panel
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: android phones 
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 13

Steps to Reproduce:
i am using ui::EditBox
in editing mode everything works fine but when editing ends it shows the color of background view that is behind `Cocos2dxglsurfaceview` at its edges if I make background view's color red: than it will show red around edges.
One more observation, even if I just render label to CCRenderTexture with fully transparent background, I still can see artifacts around letters.

![sketch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17469425/21797727/9e431238-d732-11e6-911e-7720abc6ac79.png)

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Adding async version of common CCFileUtil functions.
data.body:
Following through on #16846. 

This adds "async" versions of the major FileUtil functions, that will be performed off thread, and callback to the main thread when complete with their result.

Important Notes:

I used the AsyncTaskPool under the task type IO.
In order to keep the details of the async mechanism self contained, I pulled the functionality to a function called performOperationOffthread. This way if we ever want to change the mechanism from AsyncTaskPool to another threading mechanism, it should be easy.
While FileUtils is not thread safe, I was able to work around this by calling "fullPathForFilename" on the main thread before calling the delegate functions.
I attempted several template meta-programming solutions to this problem before settling on the submitted approach. All of the template solutions were too complex, and non readable in my opinion.
You can see I am using a number of value types instead of const-references. This is intentional as we are moving this data between threads, and I want to leverage move semantics.

@minggo

data.body: Hi, this PR fixes the typos and doxygen mistakes in the docs and comments.

data.title: Cocos2D-X 3.14 breaks some Polygon spritesheets
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: Android and iOS both have this issue
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using Cocos2D-X 3.14, some Sprites taken from existing polygon spritesheets show artifacts of other images in the same sheet. This doesn't happen for all images in the polygon spritesheet.
2. Rolling back to Cocos2D-X 3.13.1, the artifacts disappear.

Took a quick look at CCAutoPolygon and CCSprite. It looks like a lot has changed with how the polygon area is determined in a polygon sprite sheet.
